str2: One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

A teacher and interpreter of the Mosaic Law. From nomos and didaskalos; an expounder of the law, i.e. A Rabbi.

str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

str2: To come, go.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A village, country town. From keimai; a hamlet.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.
